DOC.brief_title: REACH-OUT : Chicago Children 's Diabetes Prevention Program
DOC.detailed_description: This prevention study evaluate community-based , family orient intervention call Reach-Out . The University Chicago partner community organization include Women , Infants Children [ WIC ] Clinic Chicago Department Public Health Roseland Clinic , South Side YMCA , Chicago Park District Southside Faith-Based Wellness Network church deliver intervention . Families recruit high risk population patient University Chicago Diabetes database Chicago Childhood Diabetes Registry ; La Rabida Children 's Hospital ; broad south side African-American community ( `` outreach '' population ) . Families randomize behavioral intervention ( Reach-Out Program , hand nutrition exercise ) control group ( Reach-In Program , standard care consultation ) . All participate study see University Chicago GCRC ( General Clinical Research Center ) . They ask come beginning study , 14 week , afer 1 year 2 year .
DOC.criteria: Overweight ( > 85th percentile BMI age gender ) African American child age 912 family history type 2 diabetes first second degree relative . Parents secondary subject . Inability give inform consent unwillingness randomize Prior diagnosis diabetes child plan participate Pregnancy ( woman become pregnant study omit analysis . Pregnant woman participate exercise session ) . Uncontrolled hypertension ( SBP > 160 DBP > 100 ) ( JNC V , 1993 ) Uncontrolled dyslipidemia NCEP III criterion ( NCEP , 2001 ) Evidence significant cardiovascular , pulmonary disease , serious illness Evidence alcohol drug abuse ( identify selfreport ) Musculoskeletal disease serious enough prevent participation exercise session Known suspect major psychiatric disorder Inability participate aerobic exercise activity Inability comply calorie fat restrict diet Age 65 year
